author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: I do like the way Bezillionaire rolls off the tongue.I will use it whenever the opportunity occurs and see if it catches on.

author: Rick Spilman
content: Apparently, the current term of art is centibillionaire. A centibillionaire is basically someone whose net worth exceeds 100 billion US dollars. Bezos is a centibillionaire twice over.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: How long before the word Bezillionaire finds it way into the dictionary?

author: Mike.
content:
This is the fruit of putting countless small businesses out of work, even more countless people on state aid ( i.e. kept afloat by the taxpayer) and running a business model that pays hardly any tax to anyone in return.
The ultimate achievement of capitalism. Don`t we just love it.

author: Total
content: What is this need to have ever larger and larger yachts? And with a tender?

author: Stretch
content: At least the yacht will have a higher resell price than The WaPo.

author: Willy
content:
Must be nice to have money. Then again its nice to be poor.
I dont have to look over my back to see whom is ripping me off while claiming to be a friend.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: Jeff is going to find out quickly that the best way to go sailing is on other people’s boats. Let them have all the worry and expense. If consulted, I could have given him this advice padded out a bit for a lot less than half a billion.

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
Ever larger expressions of incurable anxieties.

We could wish this pathology did not come with such large external costs.

author: Norman L. de Vall
content:
Bill Green* once said: “There is no way faster
to move money from the rich to the poor than to
build boats”.

* Green Marine Lymington England
